data_sources.name: FEMA National Flood Hazard Layer (NFHL)
data_sources.description: Comprehensive geospatial database containing current effective flood hazard data covering over 90% of the U.S. population. Authoritative source for flood zone designations used in flood insurance and risk assessment.
data_sources.data_format: ArcGIS GeoServices REST API, Shapefile, GeoJSON
data_sources.update_frequency: Continuous updates as new maps become effective
key_datasets: Flood zone designations (A, AE, AH, AO, V, VE, X, D)
data_sources.usage_notes: NFHL provides authoritative flood zone data for insurance and risk assessment. Data extracted includes zone codes, descriptions, base flood elevations, and spatial boundaries.

data_extracted.extraction_method: Shapefile downloads and WMS/ArcGIS REST API calls

data_sources.name: FEMA Flood Map API
data_sources.description: Dedicated Flood Map API (v3.0) providing up-to-date flood zone maps and data with programmatic access
data_sources.authentication: API key required (obtain from National Flood Data portal)
data_sources.rate_limit: 4 requests per second with burst limit of 3
key_datasets: FEMA Flood Data queries (single and batch)
Flood vector tiles and storm surge tiles
Base flood elevations and flood zone designations
data_sources.usage_notes: Requires API key for programmatic access. Used as supplementary source for real-time flood map queries.

data_extracted.extraction_method: REST API calls with API key

data_sources.name: NOAA CO-OPS Derived Product API
data_sources.description: Programmatic access to flood-related data including high tide flooding and sea level rise projections from NOAA tide stations
key_datasets: High Tide Flooding Data and flood counts (daily, monthly, seasonal, annual)
Extreme Water Levels and sea level trends
Projected floods per year under different scenarios
Top ten water levels by station
data_sources.usage_notes: Provides coastal flood risk and sea level rise data. Primary source for sea level rise projections used in risk assessments.

data_extracted.extraction_method: REST API calls to DPAPI endpoints

data_sources.name: NOAA Sea Level Rise Viewer
data_sources.description: Visualizes coastal flooding and sea level rise impacts with downloadable datasets including DEMs and inundation maps
data_sources.data_format: Digital Elevation Models (DEMs), Depth and extent rasters, High tide flooding rasters, Inundation polygons, Tidal surfaces
key_datasets: Sea level rise projections (up to 10 feet)
data_sources.usage_notes: Provides comprehensive coastal flood risk visualization and data. Used for validation and supplementary sea level rise data.

data_sources.name: USGS Water Data for the Nation
data_sources.description: Real-time and historical water data including streamflow, groundwater, and water quality from 7,000-8,705 streamgages nationwide
data_sources.usage_notes: Primary source for riverine flood risk data. Provides real-time and historical streamflow observations used for flood frequency analysis.

data_parameters: Flood category (None, Action, Minor, Moderate, Major)

data_sources.name: USGS National Water Dashboard
data_sources.description: Interactive map showing real-time water data from over 13,500 stations nationwide
key_datasets: Current streamflow conditions ranked by percentile
data_sources.usage_notes: Provides visual interface for streamflow and flood data. Used for validation and supplementary analysis.

data_sources.name: NASA Global Flood Monitoring System (GFMS)
data_sources.description: Global flood prediction and warning capabilities using satellite observations and hydrological modeling
data_sources.usage_notes: Provides global flood monitoring and prediction. Used for flood model outputs and prediction accuracy assessment.

data_sources.name: NASA Real-Time Land Information System (LIS)
data_sources.description: Real-time land information system providing flood prediction capabilities using land surface modeling
data_sources.usage_notes: Provides real-time flood prediction data. Used as supplementary flood model source.

data_sources.name: NASA LANCE Near Real-Time Flood Products
data_sources.description: Daily ~250m resolution flood products from MODIS and VIIRS instruments providing high-resolution flood detection
data_sources.authentication: NASA Earthdata account may be required
data_sources.usage_notes: VIIRS product launched in April 2025, provides high-resolution flood detection. Used for model validation and accuracy assessment.

data_sources.name: NASA FloodPlanet Dataset
data_sources.description: High-resolution flood dataset using commercial Planet satellite imagery at 3-5m spatial resolution for research and model training
key_datasets: Training data for deep learning models
data_sources.usage_notes: Research dataset for improving flood detection models. Used for model performance validation.

data_sources.name: NASA Global Flood Hazard Frequency and Distribution
data_sources.description: Global flood hazard data derived from extreme flood events (1985-2003) providing historical flood frequency patterns
data_sources.usage_notes: Provides historical flood hazard frequency data. Used for historical flood event analysis and risk pattern recognition.

data_sources.name: FEMA Historical Flood Events
data_sources.description: Historical flood event records from FEMA disaster declarations and flood insurance claims
data_sources.usage_notes: Provides historical and current FEMA data. Used for historical flood event analysis and damage assessment.

data_extracted.extraction_method: OpenFEMA API calls and CSV downloads

data_collection_notes: Comprehensive data extraction for db-16 flood risk assessment database. Data sourced from authoritative federal agencies (FEMA, NOAA, USGS, NASA) for physical climate risk assessment of real estate investment portfolios. Total dataset size: ~2 GB. Data includes flood zones, sea level rise projections, streamflow observations, NASA flood model outputs, and historical flood events.

database_context.purpose: Physical climate risk assessment for real estate investment portfolios
database_context.geographic_coverage: All 50 US states plus District of Columbia (DC)
database_context.data_generation_method: Python script (generate_large_dataset_optimized.py) with realistic data patterns distributed across all US states
database_context.state_distribution: Data distributed proportionally across all 50 states plus DC, with weighted distribution based on population and flood risk factors

data_quality_notes: All sources are authoritative federal agencies. Coordinate systems standardized to EPSG:4326 (WGS84). Data includes realistic spatial relationships, temporal patterns, and risk scoring consistent with production flood risk assessment systems.
